head.title: A Sci-Fi Film Fest in a Setting That's Slightly Bent

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Media, Entertainment and Publishing

hedline.hl1: A Sci-Fi Film Fest in a Setting That's Slightly Bent

abstract.p: Design firm called Big Room creates four new temporary theaters in Manhattan for Sci Fi Channel's Exposure: Future of Film Festival; photo (S)

block.p: At most film festivals, the movies are new and the theaters old. But for the Sci Fi Channel's ''Exposure: Future of Film Festival,'' tomorrow through Sunday, a Manhattan design firm called Big Room transformed space at 135 West 18th Street into four new temporary theaters, including Matrix, rendered below, which has 100 seats and a grid of luminescent wires. ''It looks like a digital landscape,'' said Julian LaVerdiere, a partner in Big Room. The festival will have 31 new and classic science fiction films, including ''Trekkies,'' and 73 shorts. Movies will also be shown at the Chelsea Clearview, 260 West 23rd Street. Filmschool (FLMSCL), a film festival producer, organized the event. Tickets are $5 daily, or $12 for all three days. Information: (212) 413-5878, or www.exposurefest.com.
